intro: Linaria elatine var. commutata, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, linear leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with two lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
